Agnes Repplier said, "There are few nudities so objectionable as the naked truth." Why is the naked truth so harsh? The naked truth feels harsh only when our ego feels it as bitter, when it makes us feel badly emotionally. There are certain discernments we must make when evaluating truth—bitter/sweet and truth/falsehood. Truth resides in the laws of nature—inter-dependence, altruism, harmony, interconnection, balance, unity. Any actions not in alignment with these laws can be considered false. The ultimate goal is that we are able to express the sweet truth. Choosing The Sweet Bitterness Of Truth | Laitman.com

Truth is shameless, only humans have ideas about covering and object to nudity of the truth because they make the truth in something exclusively the property of humans. The truth is what it is and it doesn’t care about humans’ views on it or about humans in general; and humans cannot do anything about it but keep bickering about what is fair and what is not, what is true and what is false, good or bad... The truth is similar with… let’s say an elephant- do elephants, cats or dogs care about humans’ opinions about them?!

The “naked truth” can be a purging like Mercurochrome. Although most of us would like to believe that we are better than what we actually are, when faced with the reality that we are not as ‘perfect’ and/or as ‘pure’ it can hurt like being burnt. The theological concept of the Holy Logos comes to mind. If the pure would be touched by impure, it would be contaminated. If the impure would be touched by the pure, it would be burnt, perhaps even extinguished.

Truth is not harsh and truth never soothes too. Harshness depends on the one understanding it. If one is clear in understanding then truth and the one becomes one like clear water from two sources meet. But if clarity is uniting with unclarity then it will dilute the unclarity. This is the harshness which unclarity feels. It destroys the belief of unclarity.
